intro: Palicourea triadica, commonly known as the Brazilian star apple, is a climbing shrub native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, elliptic leaves with a slightly serrated margin. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by yellow, fleshy berries that are edible. Its roots and leaves are used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties. The plant thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in humid, shaded environments.
